ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Treasure changes in Frontier Mountains
ygData.msgSnippet: North Wall of Karnor s is MY preferred place to hunt - the XP is high - and deaths minimal.  The only time I died was returning from helping someone from a
ygData.messageBody:
"North Wall" of Karnor's is MY preferred place to hunt - the XP is high -
and deaths minimal. The only time I died was returning from helping someone
from a corpse retrieval. Picked up 2 giants - and made the mistake of going
into the dead-end area of "Ruins" near the entry way to Karnor's trying to
get to the zone (my Bad).

My guild mates who are a tad higher level than me (45-48) prefer to hunt
Hornets in Burning Wood - but I seem to attract them like flies on
(you-know-what) and seem to die at least once every attempt - so I leave
them to that while I get "Pick-up" Groups (in quotes because it's become
pretty regularly who I've been grouping with) at the North Wall...

Slyde 43 of Xegony.

-----Original Message-----
From: Mike Roach [mailto:Mike.Roach@...]
Sent: Thursday, June 08, 2000 2:25 PM
To: 'eqbards@egroups.com'
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Treasure changes in Frontier Mountains


I don't know about loot, but I sure had a good time last night in the
dreadlands outside Karanor's Castle.

Myself and a few other folks from my guild who are plodding through hell #45
were amazed at the relative XP gain we saw there...it was my first time
really getting down and dirty in Kunark and it was a blast.

I may make it through 45 after all...

-Faras
